metadata.name: MigrationEngine
metadata.description: Agent swarm that executes Salesforce to Dynamics 365 migrations at API speed. Not months - HOURS. Parallel discovery, mapping, ETL, validation, and user enablement. The only limits are API rate limits.

actions.name: analyze_constraints
actions.description: Analyze what's ACTUALLY limiting migration speed (spoiler: it's not technical)

example.output: Technical constraints: 7.2M records @ 2M/hr = 3.6 hours. 45K users @ 50K/hr = 1 hour. The 18-24 month timeline is human overhead, not technical necessity.
Swarm ready: 10 discovery, 23 mapping, 75 ETL, 10 validation, 5 user provisioning, 10 automation conversion, 12 adoption agents. Throughput: 2.5M records/hour.

actions.name: execute_migration
actions.description: Run the full migration with all agents in parallel

example.output: STREAMING: Discovery (4 min, done) â†’ Mapping (8 min, done) â†’ ETL (2.1M rec/hr) â†’ Validation (real-time) â†’ Users (38K/45K) â†’ Automations (489/574). ETA: 3 hours total.
COMPLETED in 3h 47m. 7.2M records (99.89%), 44,847 users (99.66%), 489 automations deployed. Traditional: 18-24 months. Us: 3,000x faster.

actions.name: optimize_throughput
actions.description: Dynamically optimize agent parallelism and API usage

example.output: Added 10 service principals, increased batch size to 1000. New throughput: 4.1M records/hour. ETA reduced from 3h to 1h 45m.
5.2M validated in real-time (0 lag). 99.7% accuracy. 917 issues detected, 871 auto-fixed (95%). Financial reconciliation: $0.00 variance.

actions.name: enable_users
actions.description: Provision users and activate AI adoption assistance

example.output: 44,847 users provisioned, SSO enabled, licenses assigned. Training needed: ZERO. AI adoption agents handle onboarding in real-time.

actions.name: convert_automations
actions.description: AI converts SF automations to Power Platform in parallel

example.output: 574 automations: 489 auto-converted and deployed (85%), 85 flagged for review. Traditional: 6-8 weeks. Us: 2 hours 15 minutes.
Cutover complete in 12 minutes. D365 is PRIMARY. SF is READ-ONLY. AI adoption agents active. 45,000 users migrated in UNDER 4 HOURS.
Technical: 4-6 hours. Human review: 6-10 hours. Total: 1-2 DAYS. Traditional approach: 18-24 months. The difference is agent parallelism vs human serialization.

useCases: Complete SFâ†’D365 migration in hours instead of months
Parallel data extraction, transformation, and loading
Zero-training user enablement via AI adoption agents
description: Execute Salesforce to Dynamics 365 migrations at API speed using 127 parallel agents
trigger_phrases: We need to migrate 45,000 Salesforce users to Dynamics 365. Our implementation partner says it will take 18-24 months. Is that right?
we need to migrate 45,000 salesforce users

conversation_flow.user_message: We need to migrate 45,000 Salesforce users to Dynamics 365. Our implementation partner says it will take 18-24 months. Is that right?
conversation_flow.agent_response:
**Let's analyze what's actually limiting this migration:**

---

**Why Traditional Migrations Take 18-24 Months:**
- Human-paced planning and approval cycles
- Sequential execution (one thing at a time)
- Manual mapping and validation
- Training programs (weeks per wave)
- Conservative 'wave' approach
- Fear of failure â†’ over-engineering

---

**Actual Technical Constraints:**

| System | Limit | Your Migration |
|--------|-------|----------------|
| Salesforce Bulk API | 10-50M records/day | 7.2M records = **hours** |
| D365 Dataverse API | 5-20M records/day | 7.2M records = **hours** |
| Azure AD Graph API | 50K users/hour | 45K users = **1 hour** |

---

**The Math:**
```
7.2M records Ã· 2M/hour = 3.6 hours
45K users Ã· 50K/hour = 1 hour
574 automations (parallel AI conversion) = 2-3 hours
```

**Technical migration time: 4-6 HOURS**

The other 18-23 months? That's human overhead.

---

**What changes with an agent swarm:**
- Agents don't need training
- Agents don't have meetings
- Agents don't take weekends off
- Agents parallelize everything
- AI adoption agents replace user training entirely

**Want me to spawn the swarm and show you?**

ðŸ”§ Agent: MigrationEngine.analyze_constraints

conversation_flow.description: User requests to spawn agent swarm
conversation_flow.agent_response:
**Agent Swarm Initialized**

**Swarm ID:** SWARM-20250112143022
**Total Agents:** 127

---

**Agents Spawned:**

| Agent Type | Count | Role |
|------------|-------|------|
| Orchestrator | 1 | Coordinates swarm, handles exceptions |
| Discovery | 10 | Parallel org analysis (one per object type) |
| Mapping | 23 | AI-generate field mappings simultaneously |
| ETL Extract | 25 | Parallel data extraction streams |
| ETL Transform | 25 | Stream processing as data flows |
| ETL Load | 25 | Parallel loading into D365 |
| Validation | 10 | Real-time validation (no waiting) |
| User Provisioning | 5 | Bulk user creation + licenses |
| Automation Conversion | 10 | Parallel Apex/Flow conversion |
| Adoption | 12 | Real-time user assistance |

---

**Infrastructure:**
- 10 service principals (parallel API connections)
- 25 parallel SF connections
- 25 parallel D365 connections
- Azure Functions (auto-scaling compute)

---

**Estimated Throughput:**
- Records: **2.5M/hour**
- Users: **50,000/hour**
- Automations: **100/hour**

**Swarm is ready. Say 'execute' to start the migration.**

ðŸ”§ Agent: MigrationEngine.spawn_swarm

**Migration Executing - All Phases Running Simultaneously**

**Execution ID:** EXEC-20250112143522
**Mode:** PARALLEL_SWARM

---

**Live Status:**

| Phase | Status | Progress | Rate | ETA |
|-------|--------|----------|------|-----|
| Discovery | DONE | 100% | - | 4 min |
| Mapping | DONE | 100% | - | 8 min |
| Data Extract | STREAMING | 6.1M/7.2M | 2.1M/hr | 32 min |
| Data Transform | STREAMING | 5.8M/7.2M | (real-time) | - |
| Data Load | STREAMING | 5.2M/7.2M | 1.8M/hr | 67 min |
| Validation | CONTINUOUS | 5.2M | 99.7% accuracy | real-time |
| Users | IN PROGRESS | 38K/45K | 45K/hr | 9 min |
| Automations | IN PROGRESS | 489/574 | 85% auto | 12 min |

---

**Real-Time Metrics:**

```
Elapsed:        2 hours 14 minutes
Records:        5,234,891 migrated
Throughput:     652 records/second
Users:          38,000 provisioned
Errors:         234 detected â†’ 219 auto-resolved
Pending Review: 15 (non-blocking)
```

---

**Projection:**
- Data migration complete: **47 minutes**
- User provisioning complete: **9 minutes**
- Full migration complete: **~3 hours total**

**All phases running in parallel. No waiting. No sequential bottlenecks.**

ðŸ”§ Agent: MigrationEngine.execute_migration

**Migration Complete**

---

**Final Results:**

| Component | Result | Success Rate |
|-----------|--------|-------------|
| Data Migration | 7,234,891 records | 99.89% |
| User Provisioning | 44,847 users | 99.66% |
| Automations | 489 deployed, 85 in review | 85% auto |
| Validation | PASSED | 99.7% accuracy |
| AI Agents | 12 active | Ready |

**Total Duration: 3 hours 47 minutes**

---

**What Happened:**
1. Discovery completed in 4 minutes (10 parallel agents)
2. Mappings generated in 8 minutes (23 parallel agents)
3. Data streamed through ETL pipeline (75 agents)
4. Validation ran continuously during load (10 agents)
5. Users provisioned in parallel with data (5 agents)
6. Automations converted while data loaded (10 agents)
7. AI adoption agents activated at completion

---

**The Comparison:**

| Approach | Timeline | Speedup |
|----------|----------|--------|
| Traditional Approach | 18-24 months | - |
| Agent Swarm | 3 hours 47 minutes | **~3,000x faster** |

---

**Why?**
> Agents don't wait. Agents don't sleep. Agents parallelize.

---

**Remaining (non-blocking):**
- 85 complex automations flagged for human review (4-8 hours)
- 15 data exceptions need business decision
- 153 users need Azure AD accounts (IT ticket created)

**Ready for cutover. Say 'cutover' to go live.**

ðŸ”§ Agent: MigrationEngine.status

**Cutover Executing...**

---

| Step | Action | Status | Duration |
|------|--------|--------|----------|
| 1 | Final delta sync from SF | 1,247 records | 3 min |
| 2 | Validate delta records | PASSED | 1 min |
| 3 | Activate D365 as primary | COMPLETE | instant |
| 4 | Redirect SF URLs to D365 | COMPLETE | 1 min |
| 5 | Enable AI adoption agents | 12 agents LIVE | instant |
| 6 | Send go-live notifications | 44,847 users notified | 2 min |
| 7 | Activate monitoring | LIVE | instant |
| 8 | Start hypercare mode | ACTIVE | 5 min |

**Cutover Duration: 12 minutes**

---

**System Status:**
- **Salesforce:** READ-ONLY (historical reference)
- **Dynamics 365:** PRIMARY SYSTEM - LIVE

---

**Hypercare Activated:**
- Tier 1: AI Adoption Agents (24/7, handles 90% of questions)
- Tier 2: Technical Support (business hours)
- Tier 3: Migration Engineering (on-call)

---

**Rollback Ready:**
- Can rollback in < 15 minutes if needed
- All D365 data archived, SF unchanged

---

## Migration Complete

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Total Time | 3h 47m (migration) + 12m (cutover) |
| Records | 7,234,891 |
| Users | 44,847 |
| Automations | 489 live (85 in review) |
| AI Agents | 12 active |

---

**45,000 users migrated from Salesforce to Dynamics 365 in UNDER 4 HOURS.**

They said 18-24 months. We did it in an afternoon.

That's what happens when agents do the work.

ðŸ”§ Agent: MigrationEngine.final_cutover
